deaths.name: Qassim Habib
deaths.type_of_death_full: Tear gas inhalation. Qassim's family reportedly complained to the local police station about the excessive use of tear gas in their village. Shortly thereafter, the family's home was allegedly surrounded and targeted with tear gas, as shown in this amateur video footage posted on YouTube.

deaths.name: Habeeb Ebrahim
deaths.type_of_death_full: Tear gas inhalation.

deaths.name: Bassil Al-Qattan
deaths.type_of_death_full: Died due to the excessive inhalation of toxic tear gas thrown on his area.

deaths.name: Ali Radhi
deaths.type_of_death_full: Died after being struck by a passing car while running away from a police car that were chasing him.  Ali was on his way to Friday Prayers in Diraz.

deaths.name: Thirunavukkarasu Murugaiiyan
deaths.type_of_death_full: Expat. Died as a result of injuries sustained from an explosive device in the Gudaibiya area of Manama when he kicked an object wrapped in a plastic bag.

deaths.name: Shajib Mian Shukur Mian
deaths.type_of_death_full: Expat.  Died of injuries from an explosive device in Gudaibiya.

deaths.name: Asia Almadih
deaths.type_of_death_full: Tear gas inhalation.

deaths.name: Mahdi Ali Marhoon
deaths.type_of_death_full: Tear gas inhalation.

deaths.name: Huda Naema Hassan
deaths.type_of_death_full: Tear gas inhalation

deaths.name: Mohammed Mushaima
deaths.type_of_death_full: Mohammed was pronounced dead in Manama on October 2 as a result of complications from sickle-cell anemia. He had been hospitalized in Salmaniya Hospital since August 2011 and his lawyers say they had asked the Bahraini courts to release Mushaima because of his bad health, but the courts had rejected the request.

deaths.name: Ali Hussain Neamah
deaths.type_of_death_full: Died of birdshot bullets fired by security forces on a peaceful protest. Video from morgue.

deaths.name: Hassan Abdulla Ali
deaths.type_of_death_full: Complications from tear gas inhalation

deaths.name: Hussam Al-Haddad
deaths.type_of_death_full: Died in hospital as a result of injuries sustained by security forces.  Hussam was shot with a shotgun and kicked repeatedly by a man in civilian clothing in front of security forces.  Human Rights Watch said al-Haddad was unarmed.

deaths.name: Hassan Isa Hashim
deaths.type_of_death_full: Complications from tear gas inhalation.

deaths.name: Shabeer Mammed
deaths.type_of_death_full: Expat.  Died of tear gas inhalation.

deaths.name: Maryam Nasir Mohammed
deaths.type_of_death_full: Complications from tear gas inhalation.

deaths.name: Salah Abbas Habib
deaths.type_of_death_full: He died after being beaten by riot police on the eve of the Bahrain Grand Prix. Rights groups released photos showing 'injuries from a close-range blast of birdshot' blaming security forces for his death. 'He had birdshot wounds in his chest and abdomen,' said the deceased's brother, Hussain.

deaths.name: Mohammed Radhi Almahfoodh
deaths.type_of_death_full: Run into several times by a police car, which resulted in fatal injuries.

deaths.name: Khadija Mohammed Al-Abbas
deaths.type_of_death_full: Tear gas inhalation.

deaths.name: Ahmed Ismael Hussain
deaths.type_of_death_full: Ahmed, a cameraman and citizen journalist, was protesting in Salmabad when he was shot by gunfire in his upper right thigh and subsequently died in hospital. Some witnesses claim said that at 1:30AM, Ahmed was shot with a laser-pointed gun by a civilian car accompanying security forces and that he was apparently targeted due to filming. Opposition group, Al-Wefaq blamed militants loyal to the regime for Ahmed's death.

deaths.name: Hussain Majid Almajid
deaths.type_of_death_full: Tear gas inhalation.

deaths.name: Ahmed Abdulnabi Abdulrasool
deaths.type_of_death_full: Tear gas inhalation.  His cousin said Ahmed was a sailor and had a healthy body, however he and his sister became sick and started coughing blood ever since a tear gas canister was fired into their house on the evening of March 16.

deaths.name: Abda Ali Abdulmohsen
deaths.type_of_death_full: Tear gas inhalation.

deaths.name: Sabri Mahfoodh Yousif
deaths.type_of_death_full: Tear gas inhalation [13].

deaths.name: Jaffar Jassem Radhi
deaths.type_of_death_full: Tear gas inhalation [13].

deaths.name: Fadhel Al-Obaidy
deaths.type_of_death_full: Police shot Fadhel in the head with a tear gas canister during a peaceful protest on March 1 and then proceeded to beat him.

deaths.name: Sakeena Ali Marhoon
deaths.type_of_death_full: Hospitalized on 6 February 2012 as a result of inhaling tear gas and died on 6 March 2012.

deaths.name: Yahya Yousif Ahmed
deaths.type_of_death_full: Tear gas exposure during his mother’s pregnancy [13]

deaths.name: Jafar Salman Al-Alawi
deaths.type_of_death_full: The Bahrain Center for Human Rights said Jafar died as a result of injuries inflicted by security forces to the head and pelvis since 15 February 2011. He was reportedly in a coma for some time; after waking up from it, he was admitted once again to the hospital until his death on March 2, 2012.

deaths.name: Habib Kadhim Almulla
deaths.type_of_death_full: Tear gas inhalation.

deaths.name: Abda Hussain
deaths.type_of_death_full: Tear gas inhalation.

deaths.name: Rose Nisha Varghese
deaths.type_of_death_full: Expat.  Died of tear gas inhalation.

deaths.name: Mansoor Salman
deaths.type_of_death_full: Tear gas inhalation.

deaths.name: Hussain Albaggali
deaths.type_of_death_full: Reuters claimed that he died of burns sustained in January while burning tires in a protest timed to coincide with the 2012 Bahrain International Air Show. He did not seek timely medical attention, according to his family, due to fear of arrest.

deaths.name: Fatima Albasri
deaths.type_of_death_full: Complications following exposure to tear gas.

deaths.name: Ali Issa Abdulla Alhayki
deaths.type_of_death_full: Tear gas inhalation.

deaths.name: Abdali Ali Mohamed
deaths.type_of_death_full: Tear gas inhalation.

deaths.name: Zahra Ali Alhawaj
deaths.type_of_death_full: Tear gas inhalation.

deaths.name: Saeed Ali Al-Sikry
deaths.type_of_death_full: Tear gas inhalation [13].

deaths.name: Abbas Jaffar Al-Shaikh
deaths.type_of_death_full: The Bahrain Center for Human Rights said Abbas was a protester injured many times with birdshot and that exposure to tear gas may have sped up his cancer.

deaths.name: Muntadher Saeed Fakhar
deaths.type_of_death_full: Witnesses say he was arrested after police crashed into his car, beaten on the street and later tortured in Hoora police station [7].

deaths.name: Mohamed Ebrahim Yaqoob
deaths.type_of_death_full: Mohammed was run over by a police car, as shown by a video on YouTube. Upon receiving his body, he had a broken skull and signs of torture. (source)

deaths.name: Mohamed Khamis Al-Khunaizi
deaths.type_of_death_full: Tear gas inhalation.

deaths.name: Yaseen Jassim Al-Asfoor
deaths.type_of_death_full: Complications following exposure to tear gas.

deaths.name: Salma Muhsin
deaths.type_of_death_full: Tear gas inhalation.

deaths.name: Badriya Ali
deaths.type_of_death_full: The Bahrain Center for Human Rights claims that she set herself on fire after suffering from severe depression for months following the arrest of her son, who was beaten by security forces in front of her.

deaths.name: Yousif Ahmed Muwali
deaths.type_of_death_full: Yousif's body washed ashore on Amwaj Island. His family, who were not allowed to see the body until the following morning, said there were obvious signs of torture such as cigarette burns and bruises on his body, especially head, neck and arm.

deaths.name: Fakhria Jassim Al-Sakran
deaths.type_of_death_full: Tear gas inhalation.

deaths.name: Sayed Hashim Saeed Al-Momin
deaths.type_of_death_full: A medical report gave the cause of death as hematomas and bleeding as a result of a neck injury, and noted burns on the bottom-left of his chest and his left forearm. Police allegedly fired two tear gas canisters at his chest and neck from close range. This video from the morgue shows the deceased's injuries (WARNING: GRAPHIC).

deaths.name: Abdulali Ali Ahmed
deaths.type_of_death_full: Tear gas inhalation.

deaths.name: Ali Ahmed Al-Qassab
deaths.type_of_death_full: Allegedly struck by a civilian car while being chased by police.

deaths.name: Sajida Faisal
deaths.type_of_death_full: Tear gas inhalation.

deaths.name: Zahra Saleh
deaths.type_of_death_full: Zahra died after a metal rod allegedly thrown by police was lodged into her head.  The government claims that the metal rod was thrown by protestors.

deaths.name: Abdulnabi Kadhem Alaagil
deaths.type_of_death_full: Bahrain Center for Human Rights claims he died after his car was rammed into a wall by a speeding police SUV.

deaths.name: Ali Yousif Baddah
deaths.type_of_death_full: Died when a speeding police vehicle squeezed him into a wall in Juffair. Video of family members in the morgue.

deaths.name: Ali Hasan Al-Daihi
deaths.type_of_death_full: Suffered cardiac arrest the day after he was attacked by police officers.

deaths.name: Mohammed Hassanain Ali
deaths.type_of_death_full: According to his family, Mohammed died of complications from tear gas inhalation. (source)

deaths.name: Riyadh Hassan Rashid
deaths.type_of_death_full: Riyadh lost his eye when a tear gas canister fired by security forces into his home struck him. Failing to receive adequate medical treatment in Bahrain, he traveled abroad and underwent several surgeries, but eventually died while in hospital (source).

deaths.name: Ahmed Jaber Al-Qattan
deaths.type_of_death_full: Birdshot injuries to the chest. Witnesses report that police shot him.

deaths.name: Jafar Lutfallah
deaths.type_of_death_full: Tear gas inhalation.

deaths.name: Jafar Hasan Yusuf
deaths.type_of_death_full: Witnesses say police physically attacked him on two occasions in March, causing severe bruising to his body. He was admitted to a hospital for three days and eventually died.

deaths.name: Sayed Jawad Ahmed Marhoon
deaths.type_of_death_full: Tear gas inhalation.

deaths.name: Ali Jawad Alshaikh
deaths.type_of_death_full: The cause of death was 'a fractured spine, internal bleeding, and shock'. Witnesses report that they heard shots immediately after seeing a policeman holding a tear gas gun standing out of the top window of a police SUV that was chasing protesters. Video (WARNING: GRAPHIC).

deaths.name: Hussain Ali Alameer
deaths.type_of_death_full: According to his wife, Hussain, who was blind, was brutally tortured while in prison, which resulted in him urinating blood and damaged his internal organs.  He died shortly after being released.

deaths.name: Isa Altaweel
deaths.type_of_death_full: Tear gas inhalation.

deaths.name: Zainab Hassan Al-Jumaa
deaths.type_of_death_full: Tear gas inhalation.

deaths.name: Ali Abdulla Al-Sadiq
deaths.type_of_death_full: According to his family, Ali was kidnapped by security forces and tortured to death. Ali's body showed clear signs of torture, beating and electric shock. More info.

deaths.name: Majeed Mohammed Abdulaal
deaths.type_of_death_full: A shotgun injury sustained on March 14, 2011 to the right side of his head while on his way to the local bakery.  Majeed's family was not informed of his death until July 2, 2011 [8].

deaths.name: Jaber Ibrahim Alelewat
deaths.type_of_death_full: Injuries sustained while in custody. 20 days after his detention, Jaber's family was allowed to visit him and reported seeing bruises on his face, head and his left hand, which he was unable to move. He was released from custody on June 9 and left outside the entrance to a hospital. He died after three days complaining of stomach pains.

deaths.name: Adnan Hassan Almosawi
deaths.type_of_death_full: Tear gas inhalation.

deaths.name: Hassan Alsitri
deaths.type_of_death_full: Stabbed in the head with a sharp object by unknown individuals.  Hassan was on his way home from the local mosque after morning prayer when he was attacked.

deaths.name: Salman Isa Abuidrees
deaths.type_of_death_full: A heart attack caused by heightened blood pressure. He suffered from diabetes. He was allegedly stopped, beaten, and abducted by police.

deaths.name: Zainab Altajir
deaths.type_of_death_full: A sharp decline in circulation and respiration. She suffered from asthma. She allegedly inhaled tear gas fired by police, and fell over. An ambulance taking her to the hospital was allegedly subjected to delays at several checkpoints, including two checkpoints where a medic providing breathing assistance to Zainab was questioned.

deaths.name: Mohammed A. Hussain Farhan
deaths.type_of_death_full: Allegedly died from suffocation after inhaling tear gas fired by police outside his home.

deaths.name: Aziza Hassan Khamis
deaths.type_of_death_full: Cardiac arrest and cessation of breathing. She allegedly turned yellow and died from extreme stress after police broke down the door to her house and began choking her brother, and beating and kicking a neighbor's son. A medical report states that she suffered from type 1 diabetes, making her vulnerable to psychological stress.

deaths.name: Abdulkareem Fakhrawi
deaths.type_of_death_full: Injuries sustained during torture while in custody. Witnesses reported hearing Abdulkareem screaming while receiving beatings and then suddenly the screaming stopped, after which one individual said to another, 'you killed him.' Abdulkareem was co-founder of the local Alwasat newspaper and ran a local publishing house and bookshop. More info.

deaths.name: Zakariya Rashid Al-Ashiri
deaths.type_of_death_full: A blindfolded cellmate described hearing prison guards enter their cell and beat Zakariya to death when he refused to be quiet. Zakariya was a blogger and journalist who was arrested on April 2, 2011 and charged with inciting hatred towards the regime. More info

deaths.name: Ali Isa Saqer
deaths.type_of_death_full: Hypovolemic shock due to multiple traumas sustained during torture in the custody of the Ministry of the Interior. His body was covered with red bruises, in particular on the back of the hands and around the right eye.

deaths.name: Sayed Hameed Mahfoodh Alsari
deaths.type_of_death_full: His family report that they found his body in a black plastic bag with signs of physical assault and suffocation.

deaths.name: Khadijah Merza Abbas Abdulhay
deaths.type_of_death_full: The cause of death was bilateral nodular disease and acute pneumonitis caused by severe septic shock. Her family says they took her to the hospital after she inhaled a large amount of tear gas fired by police on 15 March, and were told to come back the following day. They could not access the hospital until 20 March, at which point she was hospitalized and treated for 5 days. Her condition progressively worsened until she died.

deaths.name: Hassan Jassim Makki
deaths.type_of_death_full: Cardiac arrest induced by sickle-cell disease.  Hassan was subjected to torture, as noted by Amnesty International and Médecins Sans Frontières, both of which examined his body.

deaths.name: Sayed Ahmed Saeed Shams
deaths.type_of_death_full: Hit in the head with a tear gas canister fired by police.

deaths.name: Isa Mohammed Ali
deaths.type_of_death_full: Tear gas inhalation.

deaths.name: Aziz Jumma Ayyad
deaths.type_of_death_full: Torture.  Aziz's family reports there were signs of electric shocks on the body, marks on his hands and chest and a piercing in his stomach.

deaths.name: Hani Abdulaziz Abdullah
deaths.type_of_death_full: Three or more police gunshot injuries to his right leg, left leg, and left arm. He escaped to a building under-construction where he was severely beaten and left to die in a pool of his blood. The Bahrain Independent Commission of Inquiry reports that he sustained the gunshots while running away from police.[14] Human Rights Watch investigated the room where Hani was found, and discovered fragments of his kneecap, proving he was shot from close range. Also, they found tissues in the ceiling and wall as well as a tooth. Human Rights Watch quotes witnesses as saying that Hani was shot point-blank with a shotgun.

deaths.name: Bahia Abdelrasoul Al-Aradi
deaths.type_of_death_full: A gunshot injury to the head by the Bahrain Defence Force.

deaths.name: Fatima Taqi Almosawi
deaths.type_of_death_full: According to her family, Fatima died of abuse while at Salmaniyya hospital. She suffered from sickle-cell anemia. (source)

deaths.name: Jawad Mohammed Shamlan
deaths.type_of_death_full: A bullet fired from a Browning .50 caliber machine gun by the Bahrain Defence Force.  The police first claimed to not know Jawad's whereabouts, then stated Jawad was on 'a special mission' and could not talk on the phone, and finally stated that Jawad had entered a brawl with the army and they were detaining him until the next morning. The family later called Jawad's mobile phone and reached an individual claiming to have killed Jawad. The family continued receiving calls from Jawad's mobile phone, including one call impersonating Jawad. Jawad's family has been unable to recover his car or his mobile phone [8].

deaths.name: Abdul-Rasool Hassan Al-Hujairi
deaths.type_of_death_full: Traumatic injuries to the chest, stomach, back and limbs, which led to bleeding and shock. His body was found in Awali, an area north of Rifa'a, with distinct bruises and a fractured skull.

deaths.name: Isa Radhi Al-Radhi
deaths.type_of_death_full: According to a witness' account, Isa was beaten to death by 15 police officers for around 20 minutes [12].

deaths.name: Ali Ahmad Almuraysi
deaths.type_of_death_full: According to the independent commission of inquiry, police officer Ali Al-Muraisi was reportedly struck by a car driven by demonstrators in Sitra.

deaths.name: Mohammed Faruq Abdulsamad
deaths.type_of_death_full: Police officer.  Died of severe head injury and hypovolemic shock; struck by a car driven by demonstrators near the Pearl Roundabout.

deaths.name: Kashif Ahmed Mandhour
deaths.type_of_death_full: Police officer. Died of head and chest trauma, damage to internal organs and internal bleeding; struck by a car driven by demonstrators near the Pearl Roundabout.

deaths.name: Ahmed Abdulla Alarnoot
deaths.type_of_death_full: Three close range birdshot injuries to the back

deaths.name: Jafar Mohammed Abdali
deaths.type_of_death_full: Police gunshot injury to the chest.

deaths.name: Jafar Abdulla Ma’yuf
deaths.type_of_death_full: Close range gunshot injuries to the back and chest area; shot by security forces.

deaths.name: Steven Ebraham
deaths.type_of_death_full: .50 caliber Browning Gun bullet to the right side of his chest fired by the Bahrain Defence Force

deaths.name: Mohammad Ikhlas Tozzumul
deaths.type_of_death_full: Expat.  Hit by vehicles without license plates driven by unknown individuals, one of whom was associated with government forces.

deaths.name: Ahmed Farhan Ali Farhan
deaths.type_of_death_full: Gunshot to the head from close range by a police officer. According to some witnesses, the officer was a Saudi soldier [10]. This is the amateur video footage from Salmaniyya Hospital showing Ahmed after he was shot (WARNING: GRAPHIC).

deaths.name: Ali Aldemistani
deaths.type_of_death_full: Struck by a car driven by unknowns near the Pearl Roundabout.

deaths.name: Abdulmalik Ghulam Rasool
deaths.type_of_death_full: Expat.  Died of severe chest contusion resulting in acute heart failure; attacked by a mob.

deaths.name: Abdulredha Buhmeid
deaths.type_of_death_full: Sustained at least two live bullets to the head when the Bahrain Defence Force opened fire on mourners with M16 rifles, Dilmun rifles, and Browning .50 caliber machine guns mounted on armored vehicles. Amateur video footage posted on YouTube shows the moment troops opened fire and another shows Abdulredha being carried away (WARNING: GRAPHIC).

deaths.name: Ali Mansoor Khudhair
deaths.type_of_death_full: Police birdshot wound to the back from close range.

deaths.name: Mahmood Ahmed Abu-Takki
deaths.type_of_death_full: Police birdshot wound to the back from close range.

deaths.name: Ali Ahmed Abdulla Al-Mumin
deaths.type_of_death_full: Police birdshot wound to the thighs from close range.

deaths.name: Isa Abdulhassan
deaths.type_of_death_full: Police birdshot wound to the head from a distance of a few centimeters.

deaths.name: Fadhel Salman Almatrook
deaths.type_of_death_full: Police birdshot wound to the back from close range.

deaths.name: Ali Abdulhadi Mushaima
deaths.type_of_death_full: Police birdshot wound to the back from close range.
